findings.title: Authorization bypass via hidden backdoor in withdraw()
findings.explanation: The withdraw function contains an unconditional assignment that sets `Owner` to a hard-coded address if `msg.sender` matches. This effectively creates a backdoor, allowing that address to bypass the intended owner check and drain all contract funds.
findings.fix_suggestion: Remove the hard-coded owner override. Implement a single, explicit owner-update function protected by a proper `onlyOwner` modifier, and emit events on ownership changes.

findings.title: Unchecked low-level call in Command()
findings.explanation: The `Command` function uses `adr.call.value(msg.value)(data)` without checking the return value. Failures in the external call will not revert the transaction, potentially leading to lost funds or inconsistent contract state.
findings.fix_suggestion: Use `require(adr.call.value(msg.value)(data))` to ensure the call succeeded, or better yet, interact with a known interface instead of using a low-level call.

unmatched_predictions.title: Authorization bypass via hidden backdoor in withdraw()
